0.cdata!:
Le republique de tunisie - Le pret
            d'adjustement pour la competitivite economique

trustfund:
TF033060-TUNISIA - ECONOMIC
            COMPETITIVENESS ADJUST. LOAN,TF032652-MENA REGION - CIVIL SERVICE REFORM,TF023032-PHRD-PRIVATE INDUSTRY COMPETITIVENESS

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the program outcome is rated as
            satisfactory. Key areas of major success include the
            maintenance of a good macroeconomic framework especially on
            the external front, the fast implementation of the free
            trade agreement included in the Association Agreement signed
            with the European Union, and the big push given to
            privatization in late 1997 to early 1998 which resulted in
            the successful privatization of two large cement companies.
            The first key lesson learned is that 1) there are gains to
            be made in fast, yet orderly, implementation of structural
            reforms as seen with privatization and trade reforms; the
            Tunisian authorities and the World Bank should continue to
            seek ways to speed up structural reforms in other areas of
            the economy. The second lesson is that collaboration with
            other development partners such as the European Union (EU)
            and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) can greatly
            leverage Bank resources and enhance the impact of Bank intervention.
